I ran the reports for the loc crawls for mercator and httrack.  Here's the 
number of URLs that each crawler found for www.loc.gov, including offsite 
stuff:
mercator    httrack
53042       63054

I also posted the percentages and autosummary to Files/loc_reports/ 
of the Yahoo groups.

Judy


On Mon, 21 Jul 2003, Gordon Mohr wrote:

> About 30 hours ago, I started two separate Heritrix crawls,
> with the improved HTML/Javascript and new PDF/DOC link-extraction
> code. 
> 
> --
> One was of the www.loc.gov site. This crawl is still running,
> having retrieved about 19,000 documents and counting. 
> 
> It seems to be going slower than would have been expected,
> although it is clearly politeness, not CPU, bound. The
> cause might be that it was running concurrently on crawl09
> with the other crawl (see below). 
> 
> How many did HTTrack and Mercator get, again? If we're already
> past their yields, we could stop the crawler and begin analysis;
> if not, we could give Heritrix a bit more time; it still has 
> a backlog of ~10,000 URIs and seems to have discovered about 5,000
> more in its last 1,000 visited.
> 
> The data is collecting in crawl09:/0/crawls/test-gojomo/loc-crawl
> 
> --
> The second was of the 9hosts. It seems to have had its work queues
> quickly dominated by junk URIs -- some combo of a weakness in
> the new extraction and endlessly-deep server error pages. So,
> over 115,000 URIs retrieved, over 80,000 were 4xx errors of
> various sorts. From its last status dump to stdout:
> 
> Status Code Distribution:
>         301     33
>         200     23337
>         403     53642
>         204     1
>         500     289
>         414     12781
>         303     1
>         404     21388
>         400     102
>         300     1
>         1       580
>         302     1557
> 
> I've stopped it, I'm going to see if I can discover what caused it to
> go awry, and rerun it when possible. It would help to have another set
> of eyes on the problems -- esp. the strange ".replace(/)" URIs affecting
> multiple hosts -- so please take a look at the output to see if you
> can figure out when/why things went wrong. The data is at:
> 
>   crawl09:/0/crawls/test-gojomo/heri9host/
> 
> I can be reached by mail or YM while online here.
> 
> - Gordon
> 
>
